page.title: 10COUNTRY LIFE
page.content: {The following account is by two boys {who often play within the block: { }When we get time we go down to the stream near Home Farm to build camps and bridges. Often we go out on nature rambles to see how many wild species we can spot. The most common birds around Big Wood and Bald Hill is the Buzzard. Often the Red Fox and the Red Deer are seen. Every year a{pheasant {shoot}is organised. The pheasants are bred by the people who live up the Manor. People are asked to become beaters for the shoot which travels around Big Wood and part of East hill. To-day (24th October,1985) as we travelled to school the first of the fox hounds were being gathered together for the annual{hunt}in our area. We like this area because nature is abundant and we like wildlife. Adrian Bailey & Vincent McLeod (12y)
